intro: Piriqueta duarteana var. duarteana, commonly known as the Duarte's piriqueta, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and threatened species in its native range.
